assignments.name: startTime
assignments.value: ={{ DateTime.fromISO($("Start Time + Attempt").item.json.startTime, { setZone: true }).plus({ days: 1 }).toFormat("yyyy-MM-dd")+"T09:00:00-05:00" }}

assignments.name: startTime
assignments.value: ={{ DateTime.fromISO($("Start Time + Attempt 1").item.json.startTime, { setZone: true }).plus({ days: 1 }).toFormat("yyyy-MM-dd")+"T09:00:00-05:00" }}

assignments.name: startTime
assignments.value: ={{ DateTime.fromISO($("Start Time + Attempt 2").item.json.startTime, { setZone: true }).plus({ days: 1 }).toFormat("yyyy-MM-dd")+"T09:00:00-05:00" }}

parameters.message:
=Hey {{ $json.responses.name }},

Your booking has been created for {{ $('tool-call-name').item.json.body.message.toolCalls[0].function.arguments.requestedTime }}.

You can join the meeting from this link:
{{ $json.references[0].meetingUrl }}

Thank you for your time on the phone. Look forward to meeting. 

Regards, 
Hiya - Britannia Double Glazing

parameters.content:
## Webhook Event-type Handler 
If server-event = tool-call -> check tool-call name
- name = checkCalendarN8N -> true
- name = bookCalendarN8N -> false

If server-event ≠ tool-call -> false
- end-of-call-report sent from VAPI only

## Availability Handler

Screening Availability
The workflow initializes the attempt counter and start time (formatted as "yyyy-MM-ddT09:00:00+11:00" for AEST).
The AvailSlots nodes request available slots from Cal.com within an 8-hour window using:
Event type ID
Time zone: Australia/Sydney
The response is processed:
A random subset (3 slots) is selected.
If slots are available, they are formatted for user selection.
If unavailable, the workflow marks it as "busy" and triggers a retry.
Handling Busy Availability
If no slots are found, the If Time Busy condition advances the start time by one day and retries the check.
If no slots are found after multiple attempts, the workflow moves to rolling the attempt counter.
Rolling the Attempt Counter
Each failed attempt increments the attempt counter and shifts the start time forward by a day.
The Attempt Check node prevents infinite loops, stopping retries after 3 attempts.
If the limit is not reached, the process loops back to recheck availability.
This ensures efficient slot selection, automatic retries, and controlled attempt limits

## If request time = free; 
- "We've got available slots at {{ $json.availSlots }}, do any of those work?"

## If user request time + 1 day = free; 
- "Hmm, that day is booked, we've got available slots at {{ $json.availSlots }}, for the following day. Do any of those work?"

## If user request time + 2 day = free; 
- "Hmm, that day is booked, we've got available slots at {{ $json.availSlots }}, 2 days from then. Do any of those work?"

## If user request time = busy; 
- "Looks like we are fully booked, did you want to call back in a few days?"

## Creating a Booking
1. Extracting Booking Information
The Arguments node gathers:
requestedTime: Selected time slot.
name: User’s name.
reason: Purpose of the booking.
2. Sending the Booking Request
The BookSlot node sends a POST request to https://api.cal.com/v1/bookings with:

{
  "eventTypeId": 1229827,
  "start": "{{ requestedTime }}+11:00",
  "responses": {
    "name": "{{ name }}",
    "email": "******", 
    "Phone": "******",
    "title": "Booking with {{ name }}, and Talk AI",
    "location": { "value": "integrations:google:meet", "optionValue": "" }
  },
  "metadata": {},
  "timeZone": "******",
  "language": "en",
  "description": "Discovery - {{ reason }}",
  "status": "ACCEPTED"
}


3. Confirming the Booking
If successful, an SMS confirmation is sent via Twilio.
4. Logging the Booking
The Booking Record node stores:
Meeting time
Status ("Booked")
Meeting link
Name & Phone number
5. Internal Team Notification
The Notify Team node sends a Slack message with:
Contact number
Booking time
Meeting link

## Raw Data Store

Storing;
- call id's
- durations
- costs
- transcripts / recordings
- ended-reasons

## Requirements

Cal.com account + event creation + API Key

Airtable Access Token

Twilio Account SID + Auth Token

Slack* (optional)
